body_html:
This looks good to me. If you want to have the cosine_decay_restarts in the public API , you'll need to also add the call out here:

tensorflow/tensorflow/python/training/training.py

Line 41 in e9d2b60

@@linear_cosine_decay
, and then I'll have to ask for someone from the API review team to approve the change as well.

Do you feel strongly about the new parameter name 'first_decay_steps' ? In the contrib version, it is named differently.

Lastly, I would also change the contrib version of the code to call this public version so there's not two copies of the implementation in the codebase that are largely the same.

Otherwise, looks good, and thanks for contributing!
body_text:
This looks good to me.  If you want to have the cosine_decay_restarts in the public API , you'll need to also add the call out here: 
  
    
      tensorflow/tensorflow/python/training/training.py
    
    
         Line 41
      in
      e9d2b60
    
    
    
    

        
          
           @@linear_cosine_decay 
        
    
  

, and then I'll have to ask for someone from the API review team to approve the change as well.
Do you feel strongly about the new parameter name 'first_decay_steps' ?  In the contrib version, it is named differently.
Lastly, I would also change the contrib version of the code to call this public version so there's not two copies of the implementation in the codebase that are largely the same.
Otherwise, looks good, and thanks for contributing!
body:
This looks good to me.  If you want to have the cosine_decay_restarts in the public API , you'll need to also add the call out here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/e9d2b60ed3d94eef7a3cf139cc27ec629f510681/tensorflow/python/training/training.py#L41, and then I'll have to ask for someone from the API review team to approve the change as well.

Do you feel strongly about the new parameter name 'first_decay_steps' ?  In the contrib version, it is named differently. 

Lastly, I would also change the contrib version of the code to call this public version so there's not two copies of the implementation in the codebase that are largely the same.

Otherwise, looks good, and thanks for contributing!
